sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The Odcombian banquet: dished foorth by Thomas the Coriat, and serued in by a number of noble wits in prayse of his Crudities and Crambe too. Asinus portans mysteria Coryate, Thomas, ca. 1577-1617. Coryats crudities.
[120] p.
Imprinted [by George Eld] for Thomas Thorp, [London] : 1611.
In verse. "Largely a pirated reprint of the prelims. of [Coryate, Thomas. Coryats crudities]"--STC. Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-P⁴. The first leaf is blank. Running title reads: Panegyricke verses vpon the author and his booke. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[120] p.
Imprinted [by George Eld] for Thomas Thorp, [London] : 1611.
In verse. "Largely a pirated reprint of the prelims. of [Coryate, Thomas. Coryats crudities]"--STC. Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-P⁴. The first leaf is blank. Running title reads: Panegyricke verses vpon the author and his booke. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Thomas Thorp
George Eld]
